message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "We use two complementary datasets to analyze the effect of climate change on agricultural production, namely the FAO's Agricultural Production Indices and the IPCC's climate models.", "dataset": ["FAO's Agricultural Production Indices", "IPCC"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "This study examines the relationship between financial sector development and income inequality in Nigeria using a combination of World Bank's Enterprise Surveys and Household Longitudinal Surveys.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Enterprise Surveys", "Household Longitudinal Surveys"], "topic": ["Financial Sector", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "We apply the random forest algorithm on the digitized data from World Health Organization's reports on Child Malnutrition along with Global Nutrition Report and United Nations' data on conflict to identify the risk factors for child malnutrition in conflict-affected countries.", "dataset": ["World Health Organization's reports on Child Malnutrition", "Global Nutrition Report", "United Nations"], "topic": ["Nutrition", "Fragility, Conflict, and Violence"]}, {"sentence": "Using firm-level data on innovation activities from the World Bank's Innovation Survey, we investigate the relationship between adoptability of new technologies and firms' financial performance.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Innovation Survey"], "topic": ["Financial Inclusion", "Competitiveness"]}, {"sentence": "We use the Household Income and Expenditure survey along with the poverty mapping dataset developed by the National Statistics Office to investigate the determinants of urban poverty in the Philippines.", "dataset": ["Household Income and Expenditure survey", "poverty mapping dataset developed by the National Statistics Office"], "topic": ["Urban Development", "Poverty"]}, {"sentence": "Our analysis uses household survey data from the Demographic and Health Surveys and the Multiple Indicator Cluster Survey to identify the factors affecting maternal health outcomes in sub-Saharan Africa.", "dataset": ["Demographic and Health Surveys", "Multiple Indicator Cluster Survey"], "topic": ["Health", "Gender", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "We analyze the impact of a road infrastructure project on firm's productivity using two complementary datasets: African Development Bank's Road Network dataset and World Bank's Enterprise Survey on Uganda.", "dataset": ["African Development Bank's Road Network dataset", "World Bank's Enterprise Survey on Uganda"], "topic": ["Infrastructure", "Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "This research uses the Global Findex database and the Universal Financial Access dataset along with household survey data to estimate the cost-effectiveness of promoting financial inclusion as a means to reduce poverty and achieve sustainable development goals.", "dataset": ["Global Findex database", "Universal Financial Access dataset", "household survey data"], "topic": ["Financial Inclusion", "Poverty", "Sustainable Development Goals"]}, {"sentence": "We explore the relationship between air pollution and respiratory illness using satellite data from NASA, ground-based monitoring data from the Chinese Government, and health survey data from the Chinese Center for Disease Control and Prevention.", "dataset": ["NASA", "Chinese Government", "Chinese Center for Disease Control and Prevention"], "topic": ["Environment", "Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper analyses the determinants of electricity consumption patterns in Kenya using monthly data from Kenya Power and Lighting Company and National Bureau of Statistics Household survey data.", "dataset": ["Kenya Power and Lighting Company", "National Bureau of Statistics Household survey data"], "topic": ["Energy", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]} ]

content: [{"sentence": "We use two complementary datasets to analyze the effect of climate change on agricultural production, namely the FAO's Agricultural Production Indices and the IPCC's climate
